contextId.occurrenceNote: This idiom is used to introduce a special message from God. Alternate translation: "Yahweh gave a message" or "Yawheh spoke this message" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-idiom]])
contextId.glQuote: the word of Yahweh came

contextId.occurrenceNote: This idiom is used to introduce a special message from God. See how you translated this in [Zechariah 1:1](../01/01.md). Alternate translation: "Yahweh gave a message" or "Yawheh spoke this message" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-idiom]])
contextId.glQuote: the word of Yahweh came

contextId.occurrenceNote: These phrases refer to the man who "was riding on a red horse" in [Zechariah 1:8](../01/08.md). Possible meanings are 1) the man dismounted his horse and stood or 2) the word "stood" is an idiom that means he was located in that position. Alternate translation: "the man who was among the myrtle trees" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-idiom]])
contextId.glQuote: the man who stood among the myrtle trees

contextId.occurrenceNote: This phrase refers to the man who "was riding on a red horse" in [Zechariah 1:8](../01/08.md). Possible meanings are 1) the man dismounted his horse and stood or 2) the word "stood" is an idiom that means he was located in that position. Alternate translation: "the angel of Yahweh who was among the myrtle trees" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-idiom]])
contextId.glQuote: the angel of Yahweh who stood among the myrtle trees

contextId.occurrenceNote: The phrase "at ease" means that the people thought that they lived in peace and security. Alternate translation: "I am very angry with the nations that enjoy peace and security" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-idiom]])
contextId.glQuote: I am very angry with the nations that are at ease

contextId.occurrenceNote: Since Joshua's garments were symbolic of his sinfulness, by removing his garments, the angel removed Joshua's iniquity. Causing iniquity to pass from him is an idiom that means that he had removed Joshua's iniquity. Alternate translation: "I have removed your iniquity from you" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-idiom]])
contextId.glQuote: I have caused your iniquity to pass from you

contextId.occurrenceNote: The phrase "to go and come among" is an idiom that means that Joshua will be a part of this group and have the same privilege as they do of access to Yahweh. Alternate translation: "to come before me as these who stand here do" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-idiom]] and [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-explicit]])
contextId.glQuote: to go and come among these who stand before me

contextId.occurrenceNote: This idiom is used to introduce a special message from God. Alternate translation: "Yahweh gave a message to me. He said" or "Yahweh spoke this message to me" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-idiom]])
contextId.glQuote: The word of Yahweh came to me, saying

contextId.occurrenceNote: This idiom means that these men have been anointed with fresh olive oil. A person who is anointed is one whom Yahweh has chosen or appointed for a special duty. Alternate translation: "the anointed men" or "the men whom Yahweh has appointed" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-idiom]])
contextId.glQuote: the sons of fresh olive oil

contextId.occurrenceNote: The idiom "stand before" means to be in a person's presence and to serve him. Alternate translation: "who serve the Lord" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-idiom]])
contextId.glQuote: who stand before the Lord

contextId.occurrenceNote: The phrase "the surface of the whole land" refers to every place within the land. It is implied that the curse will apply to every person who lives in the land. Alternate translation: "that is upon every person within the whole land" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-idiom]] and [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-explicit]])
contextId.glQuote: that goes out over the surface of the whole land

contextId.occurrenceNote: This idiom means that they were flying. Alternate translation: "they were flying" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-idiom]])
contextId.glQuote: wind was in their wings

contextId.occurrenceNote: The idiom to "stand before" means to be in a person's presence and to serve him. See how you translated this in [Zechariah 4:14](../04/14.md). Alternate translation: "serving the Lord of all the earth" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-idiom]])
contextId.glQuote: standing before the Lord of all the earth

contextId.occurrenceNote: This idiom is used to introduce a special message from God. Alternate translation: "Yahweh gave a message to me. He said" or "Yahweh spoke this message to me" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-idiom]])
contextId.glQuote: the word of Yahweh came to me, saying

contextId.occurrenceNote: This idiom is used to introduce a special message from God. Alternate translation: "Yahweh gave a message to Zechariah" or "Yahweh spoke this message to Zechariah" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-idiom]])
contextId.glQuote: the word of Yahweh came to Zechariah

contextId.occurrenceNote: This idiom is used to introduce a special message from God. Alternate translation: "Yahweh of hosts gave me a message. He said" or "Yahweh of hosts spoke this message to me" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-idiom]])
contextId.glQuote: the word of Yahweh of hosts came to me, saying

contextId.occurrenceNote: This idiom is used to introduce a special message from God. Alternate translation: "Yahweh gave a message to Zechariah. He said" or "Yahweh spoke this message to Zechariah" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-idiom]])
contextId.glQuote: The word of Yahweh came to Zechariah, saying

contextId.occurrenceNote: This idiom is used to introduce a special message from God. See how you translated this in [Zechariah 7:4](../07/04.md). Alternate translation: "Yahweh of hosts gave me a message. He said" or "Yahweh of hosts spoke this message to me, saying" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-idiom]])
contextId.glQuote: The word of Yahweh of hosts came to me, saying

contextId.occurrenceNote: This is an idiom that means to be courageous for the work. Alternate translation: "Be strong and courageous" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-idiom]])
contextId.glQuote: Strengthen your hands

contextId.occurrenceNote: This is an idiom that means to be courageous for the work. Alternate translation: "be strong and courageous" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-idiom]])
contextId.glQuote: let your hands be strong

contextId.occurrenceNote: This idiom is used to introduce a special message from God. See how you translated this in [Zechariah 7:4](../07/04.md). Alternate translation: "Yahweh of hosts gave me a message. He said" or "Yahweh of hosts spoke this message to me, saying" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-idiom]])
contextId.glQuote: the word of Yahweh of hosts came to me, saying

contextId.occurrenceNote: Here "cut off" is an idiom that means to stop their pride. Alternate translation: "I will make the Philistines to be proud of themselves no longer" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-idiom]])
contextId.glQuote: I will cut off the pride of the Philistines

contextId.occurrenceNote: To trample them into the mud is an idiom that means to completely defeat them. Alternate translation: "who defeat their enemies completely" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-idiom]])
contextId.glQuote: who trample their enemies into the mud of the streets in battle

contextId.occurrenceNote: Here "with them" is an idiom that means he is present to help them. Alternate translation: "Yahweh will help them" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-idiom]])
contextId.glQuote: Yahweh is with them

contextId.occurrenceNote: Here to "strike" the waves is an idiom that means he will stop the waves from forming. Stopping the afflictions of his people is spoken of as calming the waves of that sea. Alternate translation: "I will cause the waves of that sea of affliction to stop" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-idiom]] and [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-metaphor]])
contextId.glQuote: I will strike the waves of that sea

contextId.occurrenceNote: Here "set in place" is an idiom. Alternate translation: "I am about to appoint a shepherd in the land" or "I am about to put a shepherd in charge in the land" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-idiom]])
contextId.glQuote: I am about to set in place a shepherd in the land

contextId.occurrenceNote: Here "come against" is an idiom. Alternate translation: "strike and wound his right arm and pierce his right eye" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-idiom]])
contextId.glQuote: come against his arm and his right eye

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "so that they no longer think about the idols" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-idiom]] and [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: they will no longer be remembered

contextId.occurrenceNote: The idiom "turn my hand against" means to act hostile towards someone. Alternate translation: "I will attack the lowly ones" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-idiom]])
contextId.glQuote: I will turn my hand against the lowly ones

contextId.occurrenceNote: Here "in the days" is an idiom that refers to the time when Uzziah was king. Alternate translation: "when Uzziah was king of Judah" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-idiom]])
contextId.glQuote: in the days of Uzziah, king of Judah

contextId.occurrenceNote: This normally means running or flowing water, rather than still or stagnant water. (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-idiom]])
contextId.glQuote: living waters

contextId.occurrenceNote: These are idioms that refer to being hostile towards another person. Alternate translation: "Each person will grab someone, and they will fight each other" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-idiom]])
contextId.glQuote: Each one will seize the hand of another, and the hand of one will be raised up against the hand of another

contextId.occurrenceNote: Here "came against" is an idiom. Alternate translation: "that attacked Jerusalem" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-idiom]])
contextId.glQuote: that came against Jerusalem
